titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the M. Louise Curley Papers, 1946-1956 RL.11083
titlestmt.author: Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-11-13 15:30:00 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Mary Louise Curley was an economist who studied with Paul Samuelson and collaborated with Leonard Silk. This collection includes her PhD dissertation titled The Excess Profits Tax of the United States in World War II (from MIT, 1946); a preliminary edition of Samuelson's Economics: An Introductory Analysis (dating 1946); and Forecasting Business Trends, a bound consulting report for McGraw-Hill she co-authored with Leonard Silk in 1956.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Each work is foldered individually by title.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mary Louise Curley (1922-2015) earned her Ph.D. in Economics at Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1946, where she was advised by Paul Samuelson. She was the first woman to earn her PhD in Economics from MIT. Curley worked as an economist at Scudder, Stevens and Clark (New York) and at Haver Analytics.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The M. Louise Curley Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift from her son, Mark Curley, in 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], M. Louise Curley Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0152

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Rubenstein Library also holds the Paul Samuelson Papers and the Leonard Silk Papers as part of the Archive of Economic Thought.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: This collection includes a typescript copy of Curley's PhD dissertation, titled The Excess Profits Tax of the United States in World War II (from MIT, 1946); a preliminary edition of Samuelson's Economics: An Introductory Analysis (dating 1946); and Forecasting Business Trends, a bound consulting report for McGraw-Hill she co-authored with Leonard Silk in 1956.

scopecontent.p: Includes Paul Samuelson's signature on the title page.

did.unittitle: Economics: An Introductory Analysis, second preliminary edition by Paul Samuelson
Forecasting Business Trends, published as part of McGraw-Hill's Consultant Reports on Current Business Problems, written by Leonard Silk with assistance by M. Louise Curley
